abstract.t: This Internet Draft describes some extensions to the Post OfficeProtocol [POP3] and are described here for historical purposes. Thestatus of this Internet Draft will be Historic. [XTND] describes a mechanism to extend the POP3 protocol, calledXTND. Two extensions which have been implemented on some serverimplementations are XTND XMIT and XTND XLST; this memo describesthese extensions. New implementations of POP3 clients and servers are not expected toimplement these extensions; other mechanisms should be used instead.For example, [SMTP] should be used instead of XTND XMIT for sendingemail. If authentication is needed for sending email, then the proposed[ESMTP] [AUTH] extension should be used.
